title: Semantic Exploration from Language Abstractions and Pretrained Representations. (arXiv:2204.05080v3 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Effective exploration is a challenge in reinforcement learning (RL). Novelty-based exploration methods can suffer in high-dimensional state spaces, such as continuous partially-observable 3D environments. We address this challenge by defining novelty using semantically meaningful state abstractions, which can be found in learned representations shaped by natural language. In particular, we evaluate vision-language representations, pretrained on natural image captioning datasets. We show that these pretrained representations drive meaningful, task-relevant exploration and improve performance on 3D simulated environments. We also characterize why and how language provides useful abstractions for exploration by considering the impacts of using representations from a pretrained model, a language oracle, and several ablations. translated_abstract: 强化学习中的有效探索是个挑战。基于新颖性的探索方法在高维状态空间，例如连续部分可观察的3D环境中可能会受到影响。我们通过定义新颖性使用语义上有意义的状态抽象来解决这个挑战，这些抽象可以在由自然语言塑造的学习表示中找到。特别地，我们评估了预训练于自然静态图像字幕数据集上的视觉-语言表示。我们展示了这些预训练表示驱动了有意义的、相关任务的探索，并提高了在3D模拟环境中的表现。我们还通过考虑使用预训练模型、语言地标以及几个消融来表征语言为何会以及如何提供有用的探索抽象。我们在两个完全不同的任务领域中展示了我们方法的好处。一个重点是识别和操作日常物体，另一个是推理自然语言执行指令。
tldr: 本文通过使用语义上有意义的状态抽象定义新颖性，这些抽象可以在自然语言塑造的学习表示中找到，解决了在高维状态空间中进行有效探索的问题，并通过3D模拟环境中的实验验证了这一方法的有效性。
en_tdlr: This paper addresses the challenge of effective exploration in reinforcement learning by defining novelty using semantically meaningful state abstractions found in learned representations shaped by natural language, and demonstrates the method's effectiveness through experiments in 3D simulated environments.
